column1: Ah, the new farmer we've all been expecting... and whose arrival has sparked many a conversation!
column2: 啊，我們一直期待的新農夫來啦……大家都在討論你哦！

column1: I'm Elliott... I live in the little cabin by the beach. It's a pleasure to meet you.
column2: 我是艾略特……我住在海邊的小屋裡。很高興認識你。

column1: That was quite the ride!
column2: 好遠啊！

column1: I'll see you back in the valley.
column2: 谷裡見。

column1: Hopefully a crab hasn't snuck onto my clothes again.
column2: 希望不要再有螃蟹偷偷鑽進我的衣服裡了。

column1: Imagine crawling out of a pocket and finding yourself on a beach hundreds of miles from home!
column2: 想像一下你從口袋裡爬出來，結果發現自己在離家數百里的海灘上！

column1: Hmmm... Perhaps this could make for an interesting novel...
column2: 嗯……也許這可以寫成一本有趣的小說……

column1: I'm just taking a quick break to slather some coconut oil on my body.
column2: 我只是想稍作休息，塗點椰子油在身上。

column1: Gus, I'll order a round for everyone!
column2: 格斯，幫我點一杯酒給所有人！

column1: *hic*... Oh... I don't have the G.
column2: 嗝……哦……我沒那麼多錢。

column1: Heh heh... Never mind!
column2: 哈哈哈……沒關係！

column1: I've heard rumors of pirates coming to shore near here at night. They say it can get pretty wild!
column2: 我聽傳聞說夜裡會有海盜在附近上岸。聽說會很刺激！

column1: I must admit, this beach blows my own humble strand out of the water.
column2: 不得不承認，我那個小沙灘比起這個海灘根本不值一提。

column1: Oh dear! Some seaweed has tangled itself in my hair.
column2: 啊，我的天！有海藻纏在我的頭髮上了。

column1: That's the trouble with relaxing on the beach.
column2: 在海灘上度假就是會碰到這種麻煩。

column1: Excuse me... not today.
column2: 抱歉啊……今天不是時候。

column1: Why do you torment me? Can't you see you've shattered all my hopes and dreams?
column2: 為什麼你要這麼折磨我？你難道不知道你讓我所有的希望和夢想都化為泡影了嗎？

column1: Go away. I can't bear to see you.
column2: 走開。我無法忍受再見到你。

column1: You've hurt me beyond measure... but I'm willing to leave the past behind us.
column2: 你深深地傷害過我……但我願意不計前嫌。

column1: Ah... the wilted bouquet. A sight I'd hoped to never see...
column2: 啊……枯萎的花束。我真的不想看到這個……

column1: I suppose there are other horizons to set my eyes upon...
column2: 也許我該去別的地方開闊一下視野……

column1: I'm kind of new to this town myself, but I really feel at home.
column2: 我也剛到這個城鎮不久，可是我已經在這裡有了家的感覺。

column1: I moved here only a year before you.
column2: 我只比你早一年搬到這裡。

column1: I hope you've come to think of this place as 'home'.
column2: 我希望你也能漸漸把這裡當作「家」。

column1: A great idea can pass through your head when you least expect it... but if your mind is too busy you might miss it.
column2: 無心插柳柳成蔭……如果你想得太多，反而會錯過稍縱即逝的靈感。

column1: Well, I really must get back to my work.
column2: 好吧，我真的得回去工作了。

column1: The sweet friction of pen and paper is the music of my soul.
column2: 紙與筆那美妙的摩擦聲可是治癒我靈魂的音樂啊。

column1: That's why I chose this beach as my home, so that I could have peace and quiet to do my work.
column2: 因此我以這片海灘為家，這樣我就可以靜靜地完成我的工作了。

column1: The forest is a wonderful place. Have you been there?
column2: 森林可是個美妙的地方。你去過那裡了嗎？

column1: Sorry, I'm feeling morose today.
column2: 不好意思，今天我很鬱悶。

column1: I wish there was more certainty about the future.
column2: 真希望未來能更明確啊。

column1: I don't want to grow old as a lonely hermit on this beach...
column2: 我可不想老了以後就在這裡做個孤獨的隱士啊……

column1: I can't seem to find the inspiration to begin writing my novel...
column2: 我找不到小說開頭的靈感啊……

column1: I've been feeling hopeful lately. Perhaps the weather is changing.
column2: 最近我覺得未來充滿了希望。可能是因為季節變化了吧。

column1: Sometimes I wonder if I might just have an inflated self-image and no real skills...
column2: 有時我覺得自己可能是太膨脹了，其實我並沒有什麼本事……

column1: No, no... I'm not fishing for compliments. Though they are appreciated...
column2: 不，不……我這麼說不是想讓別人誇我。雖然我很希望得到表揚……

column1: It's a little lonely out here on the beach... so I apologize if I was ever a little too forward with you when we first met. I was just eager to have a friend.
column2: 在海灘上孤獨地生活真是有點寂寞呢……我得道歉，在我們第一次見到的時候我有些太著急了。我只是太想交個朋友了。

column1: It feels good to have a close friend like you.
column2: 有你這樣的好朋友真好。

column1: Hello, @.
column2: 你好，@。

column1: Are you well?
column2: 你最近好嗎？

column1: The fresh air of this valley is good for body and mind.
column2: 星露谷這裡的空氣對身體和心靈都很好哦。

column1: A quick stroll outdoors always invigorates me.
column2: 在戶外走走總是能讓我振奮起來。

column1: Ah... do not get too close to my hair with a torch...
column2: 嘿……別拿著火把離我頭髮這麼近……

column1: I'll admit... it takes me several hours each morning to make my hair look this good.
column2: 我承認……每天早上我都會花幾個小時來把髮型弄好。

column1: You probably wouldn't like it inside my cabin. It's dark and full of spiders.
column2: 你可能不會喜歡在我的小屋裡待著。那裡一片漆黑，還到處都是蜘蛛。

column1: Please excuse the sorry state of my cabin.
column2: 請原諒我這裡這麼亂。

column1: Some people are shy. Keep showing interest in them and they'll get comfortable around you.
column2: 有些人比較羞澀。只要你時時表現出對他們的興趣，他們可能就會感覺在你身邊非常舒服。

column1: Everyone likes to have friends, even that grumpy blacksmith.
column2: 每個人都喜歡交朋友的，即使是那個脾氣暴躁的鐵匠也是啊。

column1: Hello. I hope your new farming life is panning out as you'd hoped?
column2: 你好。希望你在農場的新生活進展順利啊。

column1: Oh, @! I was hoping you'd show up.
column2: 哦……@！我正想著你什麼時候來呢。

column1: It's always a pleasure to see you.
column2: 見到你太高興了。

column1: Mystery, huh? It's definitely an exciting genre. I'll remember that.
column2: 懸疑嗎？這種類型的確是很讓人興奮呢。我會記住的。

column1: Ah, one of the classic genres. I'll remember that.
column2: 啊，傳統風格啊。我會記住的。

column1: I would've never guessed! I suppose even those of the 'earthiest' profession sometimes have their heads in the stars.
column2: 我真沒想到！就算是那些「粗俗的」職業也有出人頭地的一天。

column1: I'll remember that.
column2: 我會記住的。

column1: ... I was worried you might not feel this way about another man.
column2: ……我以前還擔心你會對其他人有不同的看法呢。

column1: So am I.
column2: 我也是。

column1: Oh! I'm so sorry.
column2: 噢！對不起。

column1: Well...okay.
column2: 好啦……好啦。

column1: Here's to @!
column2: 敬@！乾杯！

column1: That's a great idea!
column2: 好主意！

column1: Here's to us!
column2: 為我們乾杯！

column1: Hmmph...forget it.
column2: 嗯……別放在心上。

column1: Ah, to a harmonious future for the community... what a virtuous idea.
column2: 啊，讓社會有個更和諧美好的未來……多麼高尚的想法啊。

column1: Here's to Pelican Town!
column2: 為了鵜鶘鎮乾杯！

column1: A gentle little sunbeam woke me up this morning. I've never felt so refreshed.
column2: 早上一抹溫柔的陽光喚醒了我。我從未有過如此清爽的感覺。

column1: I'm sorry if that isn't very interesting to you.
column2: 若你覺得無聊的話，我先說聲抱歉了。

column1: I know that I am kind of an 'oddball'.
column2: 我知道我有些「奇怪」。

column1: I hope you don't mind.
column2: 希望你不要介意。

column1: @, I know you have faith in my abilities as a writer. That means a lot to me.
column2: @，我知道你對我的寫作水準很有信心。這對我來說意義重大。

column1: I've encountered some beautiful shells in front of my house.
column2: 我在房子前面找到了許多漂亮的貝殼。

column1: I would imagine the rarer varieties to be quite valuable.
column2: 可能是很有價值的稀有品種。

column1: I write in hopes of connecting with others through time and space.
column2: 我之所以寫作，是希望和他人建立時間與空間上的聯繫。

column1: *sigh*...times are changing, though. People don't read anymore.
column2: 唉……不過時代變了。人們再也不讀書了。

column1: It must be satisfying to follow your crop from seed to harvest.
column2: 看著種子成長為成熟的作物一定感覺很心滿意足吧。

column1: It's as if your essence is infused into the fruit.
column2: 就好像你將自己的全部都注入到果實裡了一樣。

column1: Oh dear! My shoes are filled with sand.
column2: 啊啊！我的鞋裡都是沙子。

column1: That's the trouble with living on the beach.
column2: 這是在海邊生活的小麻煩之一哦。

column1: @? You look puzzled.
column2: @？你看起來暈暈的樣子呢。

column1: I guess the hot summer air can make us a little dizzy.
column2: 我看是夏天的熱浪讓我們頭暈了。

column1: The sun is angry today... My skin is a bit too delicate, I'm afraid.
column2: 今天的太陽很烈啊……我怕我的皮膚太嬌弱了。

column1: You came all the way here just to talk to me? How kind.
column2: 你大老遠來就是為了和我聊聊天嘛？你真是個好人。

column1: Visit my cabin whenever you like. I could use the company.
column2: 隨時歡迎你來這裡。能有人陪我說說話真是太好了。

column1: Hello @.
column2: 你好，@。

column1: Make sure and take breaks from your work now and then.
column2: 要注意勞逸結合啊。

column1: Come visit me if you need a break from your labors.
column2: 要是工作累了就來我這裡放鬆一下吧。

column1: I'm usually at my house.
column2: 我經常都在家。

column1: It's been said that a pirate's ship, full of plundered gold, shipwrecked here a long time ago.
column2: 據說在很久以前有一艘裝滿了黃金的海盜船在這裡失事了。

column1: @, I was just thinking about you.
column2: @，我剛剛還在想你的事情。

column1: Maybe you sensed it.
column2: 也許你感覺到了？

column1: So! Tell me about your day.
column2: 今天過得怎麼樣啊？

column1: I wouldn't mind trying my hand at farming.
column2: 我不介意嘗試一下當農夫的感覺。

column1: The quiet atmosphere of a farm might be a good source of literary inspiration, don't you think?
column2: 你不覺得農場那種安靜的氛圍很有助於發掘寫作靈感嗎？

column1: Oh dear! A tiny crab appears to have made his home in my shirt pocket.
column2: 啊啊！一隻小螃蟹好像把我的襯衫口袋當成家了。

column1: That's the trouble with living on the beach.
column2: 這是在海邊生活的小麻煩之一哦。

column1: My legs are stiff from sitting at my writing desk all night.
column2: 在書桌前坐了一整晚弄得我腿都麻了。

column1: Sometimes I envy you, @.
column2: 有時我真羨慕你，@。

column1: My legs are stiff from sitting at my writing desk all morning.
column2: 在書桌前坐了一早上弄得我腿都麻了。

column1: @, when you're around... I feel unusually creative.
column2: @，當你在我身邊的時候，我感覺特別有創造力。

column1: I know... strange, but it's true.
column2: 我知道……這種事很奇怪，可是這是真的。

column1: It gets windy this time of year. Marvelous!
column2: 每年的這個時候都會起風。太神奇了！

column1: I have to remember to water my plants today. And not with sea water this time!
column2: 我得記住每天都要給作物澆水。當然，這回可不能用海水澆了！

column1: You've come to visit me in the cold?
column2: 在這麼冷的時候你還來看我？

column1: I could do with a respite from my lonely labors.
column2: 我終於可以從這孤獨的勞動中喘口氣了。

column1: @, you've trudged through the snow to visit me?
column2: @，你冒著大雪來看我？

column1: I'm honored!
column2: 我太榮幸了！

column1: People have scraped a living off the sea for thousands of years.
column2: 很多人可都是靠海為生，延續了上千年呢。

column1: I just go to the grocery store.
column2: 我就是去趟雜貨店。

column1: @, I had a feeling that you would show up.
column2: @，我就知道你會來。

column1: Perhaps we're connected by an other-worldly thread.
column2: 也許冥冥之中，有根線將我們聯繫在一起了呢

column1: A day can never be boring when you follow the whims of your imagination.
column2: 只要有豐富的想像力你就不會感到無聊。

column1: Sorry, am I babbling on about nonsense?
column2: 抱歉，我是不是太嘮叨了？

column1: Breathe deeply. Do you notice it? That's the smell of the sea.
column2: 深呼吸一下。你感受到了嗎？大海的味道。

column1: How does it make you feel?
column2: 你有什麼感覺？

column1: Breathe deeply. Do you notice it? That's the smell of the sea.
column2: 深呼吸一下。你感受到了嗎？大海的味道。

column1: Whenever I smell the sea, it reminds me of my youth. The ocean really impressed me as a child.
column2: 每當聞到大海的味道，都會想起我小時候。小時候的大海真是給我留下了很深刻的印象。

column1: I have to brush my hair daily, or else it'll clump up into messy knots.
column2: 我每天都要梳頭，不然頭髮就會亂成一團。

column1: It's a lot of work.
column2: 這可是很麻煩的。

column1: I'm surprised I haven't just shaved it off in a fit of passion.
column2: 我居然沒有一衝動就把它們都剃了？！

column1: I suppose I am too vain.
column2: 我覺得可能是因為我太虛榮了吧。

column1: I've been doing little indoor exercises, since it's often too cold to go out.
column2: 自從天氣變得很冷後，我在室內也不怎麼運動了。

column1: Sorry if it's a little humid in the cabin.
column2: 如果這裡很潮濕的話真是抱歉。

column1: I really should scrub my floorboards today. I think an algae is starting to form.
column2: 我今天還真該打掃一下地板了。好像都開始長苔蘚了。

column1: Do you make time for cleaning?
column2: 可以幫我打掃一下嗎？
